table_description: Contains complete salary change history for all employees, tracking every salary adjustment with effective dates and reasons from 2018 to 2023.
use_cases: Analyze compensation trends by department or position
data_quality_notes: salary_amount is in IDR (Indonesian Rupiah) with DECIMAL(12,2) precision
salary_type is TEXT with CHECK constraint - use exact matches: 'Monthly', 'Hourly', 'Annual'
Most entries use 'Monthly' salary type in sample data
To get current salary: use MAX(effective_date) subquery per employee
change_reason includes values like 'Initial Salary', 'Annual Raise', 'Promotion'
Sample data contains 30 salary records for 14 employees
Multiple records per employee show salary progression

table_columns.name: salary_id
table_columns.description: Primary key. Unique identifier for each salary record.

table_columns.name: employee_id
table_columns.description: Foreign key to employees table. References the employee receiving this salary.

table_columns.name: effective_date
table_columns.description: Date when this salary amount became effective. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Use MAX(effective_date) to get current salary.

table_columns.name: salary_amount
table_columns.description: Salary amount in IDR (Indonesian Rupiah). Typically monthly salary in sample data.

table_columns.name: currency
table_columns.description: Currency code for the salary. Default is 'IDR' (Indonesian Rupiah).

table_columns.name: salary_type
table_columns.description: Type of salary payment. Allowed values: 'Monthly', 'Hourly', 'Annual'. Use exact string matches in queries.

table_columns.name: change_reason
table_columns.description: Reason for the salary change (e.g., 'Initial Salary', 'Annual Raise', 'Promotion'). Can be NULL.
